LEAD: For nearly 20 years ROBERT REDFORD has used his fame to fight for the environment. Next Saturday, the University of Massachusetts in Boston is to give him an honorary doctor of science degree for his efforts.

For nearly 20 years ROBERT REDFORD has used his fame to fight for the environment. Next Saturday, the University of Massachusetts in Boston is to give him an honorary doctor of science degree for his efforts.

Not only has Mr. Redford fought and lobbied for legislation on conservation and clean air, he founded the Institute for Resource Management which sponsors international conferences. Last year, it joined with the Soviet Academy of Sciences to sponsor a conference on global warming. The honorary degree cites ''the splendid example of world citzenship he sets.''
